name: lib/arrange.js

unknown.tagValue: arrange : A method to arrange or create a Vector from the given elements
{Array} - Array of the provided shape filled with the passed elements or random elements

params.name: shape
params.description: @requires The shape of the array to be filled or arranged

return.description: Array of the provided shape filled with the passed elements or random elements

name: lib/calcShape.js
lib/calcSize.js
lib/choose.js
exports
description:
choose : Forms a new array consisting of selected elements 
         ( Selects elements from a given array and forms a new array of those elements )

unknown.tagValue:
: [Number] : Required
         
@...args : Number/[Number] : either a single digit to select the 
                             element at given index from every element of 
                             the given ndarray or depicting the dimension of the elements
                             to select

Returns : [Number] the new array

name: lib/clip.js
lib/core.js
lib/fill.js

unknown.tagValue: fill - fills the vector according to passed args

params.name: shape
params.description: The shape of the array to be filled (Required)

params.name: initializer
params.description:
The distribution of elements to be filled
                                     { 
                                         1. 'linear' (random or uniform filling or single elem filling)
                                         2. 'zeros'  (filling with zeroes)
                                         3. 'gaussian' (gaussian distribution)
                                         4. 'custom' (fills the value acc to a passed function)
                                     }

params.name: ...args
params.description:
{
                              1. for linear, args.len === 0 => random filling
                                             args.len === 1 => fill with that value
                                             args.len === 2 => the max and min ranges with steps of min
                                             args.len === 3 => the max, min and the step
                              2. for gaussian, args[0] = mean (defaults to 0)
                                             args[1] = variance (defaults to 1)
                           }

content:
{
  "name": "vecto",
  "jest": {
    "collectCoverage": true,
    "coverageReporters": [
      "lcov",
      "text-summary"
    ],
    "coverageDirectory": "./coverage"
  },
  "version": "0.7.8",
  "description": "A JS mini library to deal with ndarrays and vectors",
  "main": "vecto.js",
  "scripts": {
    "test": "jest",
    "build": "webpack",
    "coverage": "cat ./coverage/lcov.info | ./node_modules/.bin/coveralls"
  },
  "repository": {
    "type": "git",
    "url": "git+https://github.com/abtexp/vecto.git"
  },
  "keywords": [
    "ndarray",
    "vectors"
  ],
  "author": "abtExp <atworkstudios@gmail.com>",
  "license": "MIT",
  "bugs": {
    "url": "https://github.com/abtexp/vecto/issues"
  },
  "homepage": "https://abtexp.github.io/vecto",
  "devDependencies": {
    "babel-core": "^6.26.0",
    "babel-loader": "^7.1.2",
    "babel-preset-es2015": "^6.24.1",
    "benchmark": "^2.1.4",
    "coveralls": "^2.13.1",
    "esdoc": "^1.0.4",
    "esdoc-standard-plugin": "^1.0.0",
    "gpu.js": "0.0.0",
    "istanbul": "^0.4.5",
    "jest": "^20.0.4",
    "lodash": "^4.17.4",
    "uglify-js": "^3.1.0",
    "uglifyjs-webpack-plugin": "^0.4.6",
    "webpack": "^3.5.5"
  }
}
